intro: Erythraea morierei, commonly known as the Morier's erythraea, is a rare and striking plant native to Madagascar. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red flowers and distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
